diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,153 @@
+/* Copyright 2018 The TensorFlow Authors. All Rights Reserved.
body:
BTW, the Python code was recently updated to generate symbols in finer grained namespaces (https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/c1ff1164e30186d847f7d4f9e9ce5d40936a2c1c#diff-d75a97d0f69d6f87ab79be6e2423d87b). So perhaps we could use the same for Java (without the baggage of backward compatibility. For example, `Acos` can be just in the `math` namespace and not in the top level one).

If you're enthusiastic, I'd be more than happy to see a PR adding Java API defs :)
body_html:
BTW, the Python code was recently updated to generate symbols in finer grained namespaces (c1ff116#diff-d75a97d0f69d6f87ab79be6e2423d87b). So perhaps we could use the same for Java (without the baggage of backward compatibility. For example, Acos can be just in the math namespace and not in the top level one).

If you're enthusiastic, I'd be more than happy to see a PR adding Java API defs :)
body_text:
BTW, the Python code was recently updated to generate symbols in finer grained namespaces (c1ff116#diff-d75a97d0f69d6f87ab79be6e2423d87b). So perhaps we could use the same for Java (without the baggage of backward compatibility. For example, Acos can be just in the math namespace and not in the top level one).
If you're enthusiastic, I'd be more than happy to see a PR adding Java API defs :)
